snippet: A federal judge blocked the police from enforcing a section of the state’s 2010 immigration enforcement law that prohibited people from blocking traffic when they offer day labor services on streets.
abstract: Federal Judge Susan R Bolton blocks Arizona police from enforcing a section of the state's 2010 immigration enforcement law that prohibited people from blocking traffic when they seek or offer day labor services on streets, citing First Amendment rights.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge blocked the police from enforcing a section of the state’s 2010 immigration enforcement law that prohibited people from blocking traffic when they offer day labor services on streets.
